intro: Parinari krukovii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical tree belonging to the family Sapotaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elliptical leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed. It is native to regions across Africa and thrives in humid, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical and subtropical landscapes.
